question:
In context with the recent studies about the Danakil Depression, consider the following statements:
  1. It is located in Saudi Arabia.
  2. It has some of the lowest temperatures in the world.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The Danakil Depression is located in north-east Ethiopia in Africa. It was formed by divergence of three tectonic plates at the Horn of Africa. It formed as a result of evaporation of an inland water body. The area has very low pH levels and high salinity. Statement 2 is incorrect: The Danakil Depression is one of the hottest places on earth. This is in terms of year-round average temperatures. It is also one of the lowest regions on earth. It is about a 100m below sea level. It is also highly deficient of rain.
